info.title: Power Automate Management
info.description: Power Automate Management connector enables interaction with Power Automate Management service. For example: creating, editing, and updating flows. Administrators who want to perform operations with admin privileges should call actions with the 'as Admin' suffix.

get.description: Lists all of the connectors available in the given environment. This list will include custom connectors as well as the built-in connectors.
Get the given connector in an environment.

post.description: Create a connection for the given connector in an environment.

get.description: Lists all your connection available in the given environment.
List the environments you have access to.
List all owners of the given flow in an environment.

post.description: Modify owners of the given flow in an environment.

get.description: List all run only users of the given flow in an environment.

post.description: Modify run-only users of the given flow in an environment.

get.description: List all flows you created in the given environment.
Get the given flow in an environment.

delete.description: Delete the given flow in an environment

patch.description: Update the given flow in an environment.

post.description: Stop the given flow in an environment.
Start the given flow in an environment.
Resubmit the given flow run in an environment.
List callback URL for the given flow in an environment.

get.description: List all flows in the given environment you have admin access to (deprecated).

List all flows in the given environment you have admin access to. This V2 action is a higher performance action that returns only the identifying information about the flow. The flow definition and much of the metadata is not returned. For additional metadata and the flow definition, make a subsequent call to the Get Flows as Admin action.

post.description: Modify owners of the given flow created in an environment you have admin access to.

get.description: Get the given flow from an environment you have admin access to.

post.description: Restore the given soft-deleted flow in an environment you have admin access to.

powerAppPlanExcluded.x-ms-summary: If the flow is power app plan excluded or not

connectionReferenceLogicalName.x-ms-summary: Logical name of the connection reference

FlowRunIdParameter.name: runId
FlowRunIdParameter.description: The ID of the flow run to resubmit.

FlowTriggerNameParameter.name: triggerName
FlowTriggerNameParameter.description: Name of the flow trigger to resubmit.

IncludeSoftDeletedFlowsQueryParameter.name: includeSoftDeletedFlows
IncludeSoftDeletedFlowsQueryParameter.description: Whether or not to include soft-deleted flows.
